name: client-graphql

jsDoc.doc:
Create a new GraphQL client instance.

The client provides methods for executing GraphQL queries, mutations,
and subscriptions with automatic error handling and response parsing.

tags.name: config
tags.doc: - Client configuration including URL and default options

jsDoc.doc: GraphQL error item as per GraphQL specification.
Error message
Location(s) in the GraphQL document where the error occurred
Path to the field that caused the error
Additional error metadata
GraphQL response interface with pre-loaded body.

Get response data (null if no data).
Does not throw even if errors are present.

Get the raw Web standard Response object.
Useful for streaming or accessing low-level response details.

Result kind discriminator.

Always `"graphql"` for GraphQL responses. Use this in switch statements
for type-safe narrowing of union types.

Whether the request was successful (no errors).

Inherited from ClientResult. True when errors array is null or empty,
false when GraphQL errors are present.

GraphQL errors array (null if no errors).

Contains validation, execution, or resolver errors from the GraphQL server.

Response extensions.

Custom metadata added by the GraphQL server (tracing, metrics, etc.).

Response time in milliseconds.

Inherited from ClientResult. Measures the full request/response cycle.

HTTP status code.

The underlying HTTP status (typically 200 even for GraphQL errors).

Headers from the HTTP response.

Includes content-type, cache-control, and custom headers.
Options for individual GraphQL requests.
Additional request headers
Operation name (for documents with multiple operations)
Whether to throw GraphqlError when response contains errors.

tags.value: @default true (inherited from client config if not specified)

jsDoc.doc:
GraphQL connection configuration.

Extends CommonConnectionConfig with GraphQL-specific options.
Protocol to use.
GraphQL endpoint path.
GraphQL client configuration.

GraphQL endpoint URL.

Can be a URL string or a connection configuration object.
Default headers for all requests
WebSocket endpoint URL (for subscriptions)
Custom fetch implementation (for testing/mocking)

Whether to throw GraphqlError when response contains errors.
Can be overridden per-request via GraphqlOptions.
GraphQL client interface.
Execute a GraphQL query
Execute a GraphQL mutation
Execute a GraphQL document (query or mutation)
Subscribe to a GraphQL subscription via WebSocket
Close the client and release resources
Client configuration
Options for GraphqlError constructor.
Associated GraphQL response
Base GraphQL error class.
GraphQL errors from response
Associated GraphQL response (if available)
Error thrown for network/HTTP errors before GraphQL processing.
Error thrown for GraphQL validation errors.
Error thrown for GraphQL execution errors.
Options for creating a GraphqlResponse.
Create a GraphqlResponse from parsed response data.
